Macros

#define MCSPI_NUMINSTANCES   (1U)
 maximum number fo instances supported by this driver. Default value will be 1. This will be updated depending on the CPU in xs file
 
#define MCSPI_BIOSPWRM_ENABLE   (FALSE)
 Enable/disbale the support for BIOS power management.
 
#define BUFFER_DATA_SIZE   (32U)
 Local Buffer data allocation for transcieve operation.
 
#define MCSPI_EDMAENABLE   (TRUE)
 configuration variable for enabling or disabling the edma support
 
#define MCSPI_PARAM_CHECK_ENABLE   (TRUE)
 enable to have parameter validation in the public functions
 
#define MCSPI_NUM_LOG_CHANS   (1U)
 Max SPI driver opens - which means number of s/w channels which can be opened for a single instance of SPI.
 
#define MCSPI_EDMA_BASE_ADDR   (0x40000000U)
 This is the edma base address added to the McSPI registers while configuring the EDMA src/dst address.
 
#define MCSPI_MAX_CHAN_SUPPORTED   (4U)
 Max SPI driver opens - which means number of physical channels which can be opened for a single instance of SPI. The instance 0 of Spi -> 4 channels available The instance 1 of Spi -> 2 channels available The instance 2 of Spi -> 2 channels available The instance 3 of Spi -> 1 channel available.
 
#define CLOCK_REF_FREQUENCY   (48000000)
 The reference frequency for McSPI.
 
#define MCSPI_RX_FIFO_LEN   (32U)
 Since the McSPI support only transmit-receive mode, the FIFO is shared among transmit and receive i.e each of 32 bytes. More...
 
#define MCSPI_TX_FIFO_LEN   (32U)
 Transmit FIFO lenght.

 Enumeration of the different modes of operation available for the Spi driver. More...
 
enum  Mcspi_CommMode { MCSPI_COMMMODE_MASTER = 0, MCSPI_COMMMODE_SLAVE }
 Enumeration of Master mode and slave mode of operation only one channel would be allowed to be opened in slave mode however more that one (till the max number of channel supported by driver(configurable) channel can be opened in master mode. In master mode four physical channels can be configured. More...
 
enum  Mcspi_PinOpMode { MCSPI_PINOPMODE_4PIN = 0x1, MCSPI_PINOPMODE_3PIN = 0x3 }
 MCSPI pin Opmode. This macro specifies the number of pins that will be be used by the McSpi device. This mode is used only in single channel master mode. More...
 
enum  Mcspi_ClkMode { MCSPI_MODE0, MCSPI_MODE1, MCSPI_MODE2, MCSPI_MODE3 }
 MCSPI serial clock mode. This macro specifies the 4 sub-modes of the SPI format transfer that depends on the polarity (POL) and the phase (PHA) of the SPI serial clock (SPICLK) by the McSpi device. More...
 
enum  Mcspi_ChipSelTimectrl { MCSPI_CLK_CYCLE0, MCSPI_CLK_CYCLE1, MCSPI_CLK_CYCLE2, MCSPI_CLK_CYCLE3 }

}

enum  Mcspi_InitDelay {
  MCSPI_NO_DELAY = 0x00, MCSPI_CLK_DELAY_4 = 0x01, MCSPI_CLK_DELAY_8 = 0x02, MCSPI_CLK_DELAY_16 = 0x03,
  MCSPI_CLK_DELAY_32 = 0x04
}
 This configuration is used to have delay for the first spi word transfer to give time for system to complete parallel processes. This option is meaningful in master mode and single channel mode. More...

 The McSPI transmit receive mode(TRM), this holds good for both master as well as slave mode of operation. The tx only and the rx only mode is not supported. More...

Detailed Description

Introduction.

Purpose and Scope The purpose of this document is to explain the McSpi driver on the PSP Framework architecture written in SYS/BIOS

McSpi Controller Spi is a high-speed synchronous serial input/output port that allows a serial bit stream of programmed length (one to 16 bits) to be shifted into and out of the device at a programmed bit-transfer rate. Spi is normally used for communication between the microcontroller and external peripherals or another microcontroller. Typical applications include interface to external I/O or peripheral expansion via devices such as shift registers, display drivers, and analog-to-digital converters.

SYS/BIOS System SYS/BIOS is a real time kernel provided by TI to use with its DSP processors.

Compiler defines to add/remove features Define to enable edma support.

Define to turn OFF parameter checking. Use -DPSP_DISABLE_INPUT_PARAMETER_CHECK when building library
